column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 94 of 124”
Table: 86
Capital Improvement Plan
DESCRIPTION
The last renourishment project was completed in 2004. The
cycle for this beach is every seven years. The Corps of
Engineers has remaining federal funds totaling $499,000,
which must be matched with City funding. Currently there is
no federal funding available for renourishment or
maintenance projects of this type, therefore the City's share
of the project will increase substantially.
Continue the City's program to dredge major waterways (Mill
Creek, Harris Creek, Long Creek and the southwest branch of
Back River) to improve navigation. Funding for design
work/permits is requested for FY12 for Mill Creek with
dredging to be funded the following year. Harris Creek, Long
Creek and Back River will follow that design/construction
order.
Scope of project and cost to be determined by the
Department of Public Works.
Dredging of Indian Creek from Kecoughtan Road to the
outfall in Hampton Roads. Severe build up of silt causes
upstream flooding to homes during severe weather events.
Scope of project and cost to be determined by the
Department of Public Works.
Stream restoration at the lower portion of the Mary Peake
outfall at New Market Creek.
Construct a permanent bulkhead along the pond to prevent
further erosion of the bank and runoff of sedimentation in the
tidal basin.
The Department is currently studying ways to improve the
Salt Ponds Channel Inlet with the goal of reducing sediment
buildup in the channel which will reduce the frequency of
dredging. The funding request is a projected cost which will
be used for the development of plans, permit applications and
specifications in FY11. Construction would occur in FY12.
